meanings.definition: The highest masts on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The royalmasts swayed in the wind as the ship sailed.
meanings.sent2: The sailors climbed the royalmasts to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the royalmasts, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The royalmasts reached for the sky like giants standing guard over the vessel.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the royalmasts in shades of orange and pink, creating a majestic sight.

meanings.definition: The masts that support the royal sails.
meanings.sent1: The royalmasts held the billowing sails high above the deck.
meanings.sent2: The crew worked together to raise the royalmasts for a smooth voyage.
meanings.sent3: A mischievous seagull landed on the royalmasts, thinking it was a perfect perch.
meanings.sent4: The royalmasts stood tall like guardians protecting the ship from the storm.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind whistling through the royalmasts was both eerie and calming at the same time.

meanings.sent1: The shipbuilder will royalmasts the new vessel before its maiden voyage.
meanings.sent2: It takes skilled hands to royalmasts a ship properly for smooth sailing.
meanings.sent3: The captain decided to royalmasts the ship with the finest wood available.
meanings.sent4: The crew worked tirelessly to royalmasts the ship in time for the regatta.
meanings.sent5: The decision to royalmasts the ship with sturdy masts proved to be wise during the storm.
